item.title: lisa_emily add a quote by Leonora Carrington (Down Below)
item.description: "The task of the right eye is to peer into the telescope, while the left eye peers into the microscope. " -- Leonora Carrington (Down Below)

item.title: lisa_emily add a quote by Fernando Pessoa
item.description: "Literature is the most agreeable way of ignoring life." -- Fernando Pessoa

item.title: lisa_emily add a quote by Walter Benjamin
item.description: "The crowd is the veil through which the familiar city beckons to the flÃ¢neur as phantasmagoria-now a landscape, now a room." -- Walter Benjamin

item.title: lisa_emily add a quote by Gaston Bachelard
item.description: "I am alone so I dream of the being who has cured my solitude, who would be cured by solitudes. With its life, it brought me the idealizations of life, all the idealizations which give life a double, which lead life toward it summits, which make the dreamer too live by splitting..." -- Gaston Bachelard

item.title: lisa_emily add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in the mind at the same time, and still retain the ability to function." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: lisa_emily add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "the cracked plate has to be retained in the pantry, has to be kept in service as a household necessity. It can never be warmed on the stove nor shuffled with the other plates in the dishpan; it will not be brought out for company but it will do to hold crackers late at night or to go into the ice-box with the left overs." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald
